title: Aloo Gobi Capsicum Gravy 😀 | Side Dish
content:
Side Dish: Aloo Gobi Capsicum Gravy  Servings: 2 Kadai  Duration: 30 Minuets  This curry is a simple and quick fix side dish and a perfect combination with Roti/ Chapathi/ Naan / Rumali Roti & also you can serve with Piping hot rice 🍚 It’s from North Indian cuisine & a big hit anytime. You can also make this curry with the combination of aloo & Gobi or Aloo Gobi Capsicum as I would prefer to make more veggies means more healthy and tasty 😋 Let’s start with Ingredients and follows Procedure Ingredients:
  • Potatoes /Aloo - 2 Medium sized - Peeled off & diced
  • Cauliflower/ Gobi - 30 florets
  • Orange Capsicum - 1 - Diced (you can use any color)
  • Red onion - Petals - 16 no’s
  • Tomato puree - 6 Diced Tomatoes (small size) + 1/2 onion + 2 tb sp ginger + 200 ml water - Blend altogether till smooth puree
  • Cumin seeds - 1 tsp
  • Bay leaves - 2
  • Butter - 4 Tb sp
  • Red chilly powder - 1 1/2 tsp
  • Cumin Powder - 1 1/2 tsp
  • Coriander Powder - 2 tsp
  • Salt - 1 tsp
  • Turmeric Powder - 1/4 tsp
  • Garam Masala Powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Coriander leaves - chopped - 1 cup
Procedure:
  • Heat frying pan over medium heat
  • Add 2 Tb sp butter
  • Let it melt, add cumin seeds and bay leaves
  • Saute a minute and add blended tomatoes 🍅 puree
  • Stir continuously till it reduces half
  • Next, Add salt, red chilly powder, Garam masala powder, salt, coriander & cumin powder
  • Mix well & add veggies
  • Cook 20 mins or till gravy thickens
  • Turn off heat, finally garnish with cilantro & mix well
  • Serve hot with Roti & Garlic Butter Naan 
  • Happy Cooking and have a lovely day
